intro: Buxus sempervirens f. rubra, commonly known as the red-leaf boxwood, is a cultivar of the common boxwood characterized by its distinctive reddish foliage. It is a slow-growing evergreen shrub that features dense, compact growth habits, making it popular for formal garden landscaping. The leaves are typically oval-shaped with a glossy, dark green upper surface and a reddish or bronze hue on the underside. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full shade, thriving in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is often used in topiary and hedging applications.
